Job Title: Senior Director

Location: Charlotte Metro

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Distribution, Management, Supply Chain

Description:
Sr. Director, Facilities LeaderChina Grove, NC, United States$163,700 - $272,900 Annually*
* based on job, location, and schedule
JOB DESCRIPTION
Bring Your Amazing Self to Work
At Macy's, Inc. we're on a mission to create a brighter future with bold representation for all. This is our Mission Every One. We know that each person here is unique. So we respect and invest in each individual to create growth, pride, and satisfaction. If we are able to bring our whole selves to work, it translates into a more abundant and wider array of ideas and energy for all to benefit from. Our success will be built on amazing colleagues, working together.
Job OverviewThe Senior Director, Customer Fulfillment Center oversees all aspects of leadership, engagement, strategic planning, and overall financial and operational performance of the goods-to-person customer fulfillment center operations. They develop short- and long-term plans to drive continuous improvement and ensure achievement of facility and organizational objectives. Additionally, they provide high-level leadership, direction, and coaching to the CFC leadership team to successfully and effectively accomplish operational goals and attain optimum performance levels.
This individual will run our entire Brand-New State of the Art Customer Fulfillment Center located outside Charlotte in China Grove, North Carolina. They will have a team of senior leaders (Directors) reporting up to them. 
What You Will DoProvide coaching and training to colleagues through both informal and formal programs. Establish consistent standards with the leadership team to ensure uniform coaching and performance-based feedback for all colleagues, while also maintaining accountability for results.Cultivate and sustain a culture dedicated to engagement and diversity, equity, and inclusion by fostering a colleague-centered workplace that prioritizes care and concern for all individuals.Ensure the efficiency of work methods, procedures, controls, and staffing, recommending alternatives as necessary to facilitate accurate and timely movement and processing of products. Manage warehouse layout to maximize efficiency, adapting to seasonal and inventory fluctuations.Lead all operational departments in alignment with company profit objectives and customer experience goals.Possess a thorough understanding of all operations KPIs, including production and planning, cost control, safety, inventory, facility maintenance, and shortage.Demonstrate strong community-building skills and serve as a senior leadership representative for Macy's community relations.Spearhead process improvement initiatives and identify opportunities for optimization, actively participating in strategic and business process improvement projects within the distribution network.Coordinate budget preparation and execution across operational functional areas.Review analyses of activities, costs, operations, and forecast data to track department progress toward stated goals and objectives. Continuously drive process improvement efforts to enhance efficiency and reduce overall costs.Collaborate with business partners to achieve results and implement solutions across key components of business operations, including Finance, Human Resources, Asset Protection, Merchandising, and Stores.Uphold a culture of safety throughout the organization.
Skills You Will NeedLeadership: Proven ability to develop high-performing teams, foster a culture of engagement, inclusion, and community, and drive results through effective leadership. Ability to effectively lead Goods-to-Person and Pocket Sorter automation.Strategic Thinking: Strong strategic skills to develop short- and long-term plans for continuous improvement and achievement of organizational objectives.Communication and Collaboration: Excellent communication and collaboration skills to effectively interact with stakeholders across various departments and levels within the organization.Adaptability: Ability to adapt to changing priorities and demands.Team Development: Skill in managing and developing direct reports, fostering individual growth and performance excellence, and building effective teams.Financial Acumen: Strong financial skills and understanding of supply chain metrics to drive business results and make informed decisions.Relationship Building: Ability to establish trust and credibility with internal and external stakeholders, cultivating smooth working relationships and rapport.Problem-Solving: React quickly and appropriately to operational issues, follow up on unresolved matters promptly, and drive continuous process improvement.Customer Focus: Create a customer-focused environment where excellent service is provided to all customers, ensuring business decisions align with customer needs and expectations.Technical Proficiency: Proficiency in Microsoft Office suite (Word, Excel, Outlook) and other relevant business software to effectively analyze data and communicate information.Industry Understanding: Goods-to-Person automation, business and intellectual competencies, including industry understanding of warehouse management, negotiation skills, strategic planning, staff development, and creativity in problem-solving.
Who You AreDedicated to fulfilling ideals of diversity, inclusion, and respect that Macy’s aspires to achieve every day in every way.Candidates with a bachelor’s degree or equivalent work experience in a related field are encouraged to apply. 5+ years’ advanced knowledge of Supply Chain processes and systems.This position requires heavy lifting, constant moving, standing, and reaching with arms and hands. Involves standing for at least two consecutive hours, lifting at least 30 lbs. stooping, kneeling, crouching, and climbing ladders. May involve reaching above eye level. Requires close vision, color vision, depth perception, and focus adjustment.Able to work a flexible schedule, including days, evenings, weekends, and holidays, based on department and company needs.Travel required up to 15%.
What We Can Offer YouAn inclusive, challenging, and refreshingly fun work environmentCompetitive pay and benefits rooted in principles of equityPerformance incentives and annual merit reviewMerchandise discountsHealth and Wellness Benefits across medical, dental, vision, and additional insuranceRetirement Savings Plan with 401k match opportunityEmployee Assistance Program (mental health counseling and legal/financial advice)Resources for continuous learning, career growth, and leadership development8 paid holidaysPaid Time Off (first year prorated depending on start date)Tuition reimbursement programGuild education benefit funds 100% of tuition, books, and fees in designated programsColleague Resource Groups (CRGs) and give-back/volunteer opportunitiesEmpowerment and autonomy to perform impactful work with tangible results
About Macy’sNow is an exciting time for a Macy's career as we continue to focus on creating exciting and memorable experiences for every Macy's customer, whether their journey starts online or in the store. Our opportunities in Sales, Merchandise, Operations, Customer Service, Warehouse, Marketing, and other areas let you express your creativity and commitment to excellence, grow your career and make a difference to your Macy's colleagues and customers.Bring your creativity, energy, and ideas to the Macy's team – Apply Today!This job description is not all-inclusive. Macy's, Inc. reserves the right to amend this job description at any time. Macy's, Inc. is an Equal Opportunity Employer, committed to a diverse and inclusive work environment.
This position may be eligible for performance-based incentives/bonuses in addition to the attached Benefits. Eligibility requirements may apply based on location, job level, classification, and length of employment. Visit https://bit.ly/3Sy3fOs to see details on benefits.

Experience Level (if available): Director
